content:
That's all reasonable, but imagine a rake that is dragging itself through the ground and pulling all the leaves and gravel with it. 

It is the case like you are describing that all the rocks and leaves that are caught in the rake are "from over there", but there are also many leaves and rocks that fell through the cracks and are no longer in the tines. What is actually you is exactly what is currently caught in the rake, which isn't from the past or going somewhere in the future, it is all "right here, right now, caught in the rake". 

It can be helpful to consider that 99% of the things you have experienced you have forgot and that 99% of the rocks the rake has touched are gone. Anything retained is only because it has relevance or attachment to the present circumstance.
